channel.title: jimgrisham tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from jimgrisham.

item.description: @moscow_english @sentdefender It‚Äôs not _that_ small of an area. They‚Äôd all fit in a large-sized harbor. The Black Sea is has a _surface area_ of 168,500 mi¬≤, equal area to a square 410 miles on each side. (i.e. 436,400 km¬≤, equal area to a square 660 km on each side) Also, submarines operate in 3D space.

@Bear_Faced @ClavdiaMinor @sentdefender Yes, but if poor maintenance practices had not lead to that fire (oily bilge water causing self-ignition of chemical oxygen generator cartridges, if I recall correctly), those crew members could have survived until rescued.
@econoar @BeijingPalmer So you‚Äôre sayin‚Äô there‚Äôs a chance‚Ä¶

@Bill_Abely @brandonazheng @Noahpinion ‚ÄúThey‚Äù has long been a default when it is not known what pronoun to use; e.g.: A: ‚ÄúSomeone broke into my car last night.‚Äù B: ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs horrible! Did they steal anything valuable?‚Äù A: ‚ÄúNo, that almost makes it worse. They broke two windows for nothing!‚Äù B: ‚ÄúI hope they get caught!‚Äù
@TwitrSvcksA @RegimeChangeInc @TrentTelenko After the first or second shot, I can‚Äôt imagine even a Harry Potter invisibility cloak would be much help in today‚Äôs environment.
@Crisdibb @Schmidtlepp @UAWeapons They can, optionally. It screws into the pointy end of the shell (in place of a traditional fuze), and has small fins to enable limited course corrections.
@jprupp @FreightAlley @EricRego8 Tl;dr: Not really. (unless @KenworthTruckCo, @Freightliner, or @VolvoTrucksNA start selling turbojet-powered road tractors)
@ruaviationtrac @DaveDopson @TrentTelenko @Gibwashere @CondorOnRegis3 @Cunts91335691 @thewinelake @Blue_Sauron @herooftheday10 It‚Äôll be fine.

@ManAboutCouch @avocadothethird @PhillipsPOBrien I believe the reporting from a few days ago was that not only had they not yet arrived, contract negotiations for the purchase had yet to be completed.

@AbeFromanSox @ExtremelyTrains @RickPalaciosJr Homebuilding remains incredibly labor-intensive and resistant to automation. Apparently there are some in areas with short building seasons (e.g. Minnesota, USA) that factory-build wall panels (complete with insulation, piping, drywall, etc) to be crane-assembled on-site.
@ExtremelyTrains @Bradorado1 @whitemice @RickPalaciosJr No one is offering them at a 2x salary multiplier as was common as little as 30 years ago, so that‚Äôs not incredibly surprising.

@Bradorado1 @whitemice @ExtremelyTrains @RickPalaciosJr Smaller ranch style homes often necessitate more yard space to compensate for reduced indoor space (think: kids playroom vs yard swingset). More yard space means fewer lots / acre for the developer, which also lowers profits.
@EricRego8 @FreightAlley https://t.co/MzfoqL5c04
@Gigi_MCal @jprupp @FreightAlley @EricRego8 https://t.co/MzfoqL5c04

@or_fade @TaintedSaint2 @SageMD1908 @CactusBerg @sarahnferris 12-packs of Coca-Cola at grocery stores seem to be around $6 to $8 when not on sale. At a Walmart in the South last night, they were just under $6.
@klausenhauser @ChefMiew @sdbaral Elevators are known for their amazing cellular & WiFi reception, after all.

@slamastack The only safe tech for this sort of thing is legacy, open-standard tech such as #X10 or #Insteon and the modern (but much more complicated) #Zigbee or proprietary (#Zwave) equivalents. Worst-case, a hub might have to be replaced. My X-10 switches from the mid-90s still work!

@DrKateJMiller @NatMorson My ADHD brain would probably have done great as a farmer in a pre-industrial world‚Ä¶ and likewise thrived in the strict structure of the military (as long as I was on duty). In the world in which we live, though, it needs medication (until better treatments are discovered).

@LisaEsther6 @DrKateJMiller When it‚Äôs not caught until adulthood, there is a whole smorgasbord of learned coping mechanisms and maladaptive behaviors that need to be unraveled. That process isn‚Äôt quick or easy. üòû

@DrKateJMiller @CanadianKayMD I‚Äôve heard that until a decade or so ago, the common belief was that it was something kids outgrew by adulthood, so diagnosis was rarely sought or offered. It‚Äôs probably _vastly_ undiagnosed in people currently over age 30, and even more so for people over age 50.

@PenfoldDavid @TwitterSafety @wongmjane We‚Äôve been continuously working to combat spammy & duplicative content on Twitter at scale and our new Copypasta and Duplicate Content policy clarifies what constitutes a violation along with what happens when it is violated.
